title: (x) Moondog album cover type - Clarendon/Belizio {Mike Y, Prakash}
content:
does anyone know the font they are using for “MOONDOG” on this album cover?

[http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000026E9X/qid=1142915028/sr=1-449/ref=...](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163451/http:/www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000026E9X/qid=1142915028/sr=1-449/ref=sr_1_449/104-1689805-1278349?s=music&v=glance&n=5174 "http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B000026E9X/qid=1142915028/sr=1-449/ref=sr\_1\_449/104-1689805-1278349?s=music&v=glance&n=5174")

thanks for any help.

(sorry, i’m new here and couldn’t figure out how to post the pic)

 [‹ (x) serif face on Oxford University Press world classics series covers - Pegasus {Mike Y}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163451/http:/typophile.com/node/18673 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Type on playing cards - Numbers Deuce {Koleslaw} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071023163451/http:/typophile.com/node/18736 "Go to next forum topic")
author: devin

comments.content:
Looks like Clarendon Bold (many sources).

- Mike Yanega

No its Belizio Bold.  
Look at the more widened O. But if you use Clarendon no one will be the wiser.
i thank you both for the information! it is greatly appreciated.
